snippet: The Internal Revenue Service’s special scrutiny went beyond keyword hunts for organizations with “Tea Party” or “patriot” in their names, to a more overtly ideological search.
abstract: Details emerge about Internal Revenue Service's special scrutiny of small-government groups applying for tax-exempt status, showing that agency engaged in an overtly ideological search that targeted Tea Party and other conservative groups; details emerge as part of draft audit that has been submitted to Congress, where House Republicans have vowed to begin their own hearings and investigations into scandal.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and MATTHEW L. WALD

lead_paragraph: The Internal Revenue Service’s special scrutiny went beyond keyword hunts for organizations with “Tea Party” or “patriot” in their names, to a more overtly ideological search.

headline.seo: I.R.S. Scandal Gives G.O.P. Issue to Seize On
headline.main: I.R.S. Focus on Conservatives Gives G.O.P. an Issue to Seize On
headline.print_headline: I.R.S. Focus on Conservatives Gives G.O.P. an Issue to Seize On
